def: Pertaining to, or like, a flock.For this gregal conformity there is an excuse. W. S. Mayo.

Not permeable; not permitting passage, as of a fluid. throughits substance; impervious; impenetrable; as, India rubber isimpermeable to water and to air.-- Im*per"me*a*ble*ness, n.-- Im*per"me*a*bly, adv.
To award; to adjudge. [Obs.] "Unto him they did addeem theprise." Spenser.
One in a flight of steps which are curved in plan, so that eachtread is broader at one end than at the other; -- distinguished fromflyer.
The employment or arrangement of columns in a structure. Gwilt.
One of a numerous family of hymenopterous insects (Chalcidid√¶.Many are gallflies, others are parasitic on insects.
A woman who is a slave, or in bondage.He who was of the bondwoman. Gal. iv. 23.
A word formerly used to express thankfulness, with surprise;many thanks.Gramercy, Mammon, said the gentle knight. Spenser.
Capable of being affiliated to or on, or connected with inorigin.
